sentences: Megadeth is an American heavy metal band formed in Los Angeles in 1983 by vocalist/guitarist Dave Mustaine and bassist David Ellefson.
In 1985, Megadeth released its debut album, Killing Is My Business... and Business Is Good!, on the independent record label Combat Records, to moderate success.
Their first major-label album, Peace Sells... but Who's Buying?, was released in 1986 and was a major hit with the underground metal scene.
Band members' substance abuse issues and personal disputes had brought Megadeth negative publicity during the late 1980s.
So What! (1988), Rust in Peace (1990), and Countdown to Extinction (1992).
So What! (1988), Rust in Peace (1990), and Countdown to Extinction (1992).
So What! (1988), Rust in Peace (1990), and Countdown to Extinction (1992).
The band temporarily disbanded in 2002 when Mustaine suffered an arm injury and re-established in 2004 without Ellefson, who had taken legal action against him.
The band temporarily disbanded in 2002 when Mustaine suffered an arm injury and re-established in 2004 without Ellefson, who had taken legal action against him.
Ellefson settled out of court and rejoined in 2010, but was fired from the band in 2021 amid allegations of sexual misconduct that were later unfounded.
Ellefson settled out of court and rejoined in 2010, but was fired from the band in 2021 amid allegations of sexual misconduct that were later unfounded.
Megadeth's current lineup includes Mustaine, guitarist Kiko Loureiro and drummer Dirk Verbeuren; former bassist James LoMenzo currently serves as touring bassist.
Megadeth won its first Grammy Award in 2017 for the song "Dystopia" in the Best Metal Performance category.
Megadeth has hosted its own music festival Gigantour, several times since July 2005, and held its first annual MegaCruise in October 2019.
Megadeth has hosted its own music festival Gigantour, several times since July 2005, and held its first annual MegaCruise in October 2019.

sentences: During a live performance of "Anarchy in the U.K." at a 1988 show in Antrim, Northern Ireland, Mustaine drunkenly and confusedly dedicated the song to "the cause" of "giving Ireland back to the Irish!"
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: In 1988, MTV deemed that the song "In My Darkest Hour" encouraged suicide and banned the video.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: In 1988, MTV deemed that the song "In My Darkest Hour" encouraged suicide and banned the video.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: During a world tour in 2001, the Malaysian government canceled the band's show in the nation's capital because the authorities had a negative perception of the group's image and music.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: "In 2003, after recovering from an arm injury that threatened to end his career, Mustaine became a born-again Christian.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: In May 2005, Mustaine allegedly threatened to cancel shows in Greece and Israel with extreme metal bands Rotting Christ and Dissection due to the bands' anti-Christian beliefs.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: In July 2004, former bassist Ellefson sued Mustaine for $18.5 million in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: The suit was dismissed in 2005, and Mustaine filed a countersuit alleging that Ellefson had used the band's name in an advertisement for musical equipment; the suit was settled out of court.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: On May 10, 2021, sexually explicit videos of Ellefson were posted on Twitter.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: Ellefson then posted her statement and one of his own on May 10th, asserting that the allegations of grooming were false.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: An official statement released the next day from Megadeth stated that the situation was being "watched closely".
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: Mustaine later announced Ellefson was fired from the band on May 24, 2021.
section: == Controversies ==

sentences: Drummer Shawn Drover stated that Mustaine had saved many riffs over the years and that some recent material is based on those demo recordings.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences and style ===

sentences: The music of Megadeth and its underground metal contemporaries from the 1980s featured harsh vocals, double bass drum patterns, staccato riffing, power chords, tremolo picking, and screeching lead guitar work; albums from this period were produced on low budgets.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences and style ===

sentences: In 2017, David Ellefson talked in an interview about how the band recently started to use a lower tuning saying: "it's just natural with age, for singers it can be a struggle, so rather than quit, than not play, how do you work it around?

sentences: "During the band's early days, Mustaine was the rhythm guitarist, while Chris Poland played lead.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences and style ===

sentences: Poland performed only on Megadeth's first two albums at the time of the book's release; (he would go on to play on the 2004 album The System Has Failed); music journalists Pete Prown and Harvey P. Newquist credit him with making the music more colorful because of his jazz influences.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences and style ===

sentences: Studio efforts released in the mid- and late 1990s featured songs with compact structures and less complicated riffing.
section: == Artistry == | === Influences and style ===

sentences: Having sold about 38 million units worldwide, Megadeth is one of the few bands from the 1980s American underground metal scene to have achieved mass commercial success.
section: == Artistry == | === Legacy ===

sentences: Megadeth is considered one of the most musically influential groups that originated in the 1980s.
section: == Artistry == | === Legacy ===

sentences: Sociologist Keith Kahn-Harris wrote that the mainstream success of Megadeth was one of the reasons for the expansion of extreme metal to countries where it had previously been unknown.
section: == Artistry == | === Legacy ===

sentences: The band's sound and album artwork influenced a number of thrash metal bands in the 21st century, including Toxic Holocaust and Warbringer.
section: == Artistry == | === Legacy ===

sentences: According to Nielsen SoundScan, Megadeth has sold 9.2 million copies of its albums in the United States between 1991 and 2014.
